oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cannon balls from Belmont, Kentucky battlefield
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These large cannonballs are from the Columbus-Belmont battlefield. In November 1861, Federal troops attempted to attack Confederate forces in Columbus, Kentucky. The Confederates crossed the river to Belmont, Missouri. The Federal troops captured the; the Confederate camps but they counterattacked and shelled the Federals with heavy cannon emplaced on the Kentucky side of the river. The Federals withdrew. These cannon balls are probably those used by the Confederate artillery.
